title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: Suppose mm studies evaluate diagnostic accuracy test. iith study, let TPi\mbox{TP}_i: number true positives FNi\mbox{FN}_i: number false negatives FPi\mbox{FP}_i: number false positives TNi\mbox{TN}_i: number true negatives data wish collect =1,â€¦,mi=1,\ldots, m. Write Ni=TPi+FNiN_i=\mbox{TP}_i+\mbox{FN}_i, number cases; Nâ€¾=FPi+TNi\bar N_i=\mbox{FP}_i + \mbox{TN}_i, number non-cases; ni=Ni+Nâ€¾in_i = N_i + \bar N_i, total sample size. Let pip_i denote sensitivity, qiq_i specificity, Ï€i\pi_i prevalence cases iith study. missing data, can easily estimate pÌ‚=TPi/Ni\hat p_i=\mbox{TP}_i/N_i, qÌ‚=TNi/Nâ€¾\hat q_i=\mbox{TN}_i/\bar N_i, Ï€Ì‚=Ni/ni\hat\pi_i=N_i/n_i, respectively. can also feed entire data (TPi,FNi,FPi,TNi)(\mbox{TP}_i, \mbox{FN}_i, \mbox{FP}_i, \mbox{TN}_i)(=1,â€¦,m)(=1,\ldots, m) standard software, e.g., mada (Sousa-Pinto 2022), meta-analysis.

title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: Consider scenario non-cases study ii, FNi\mbox{FN}_i, TNi=\mbox{TN}_i=NA. example: aim fill missing values FNi\mbox{FN}_i TNi\mbox{TN}_i multiple imputations (MI).

title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: can think data generated two stages. First, total sample size nin_i, relative size NiN_i vs Nâ€¾\bar N_i determined prevalence Ï€i\pi_i. Second, given NiN_i Nâ€¾\bar N_i, relative size TPi\mbox{TP}_i vs FNi\mbox{FN}_i, FPi\mbox{FP}_i vs TNi\mbox{TN}_i, determined sensitivity pip_i specificity qiq_i, respectively. leads us posit two-level model prevalence sensitivity-specificity relationship: first allows us impute size cases non-cases; second impute specificity sensitivity (vice versa). account -study heterogeneity, add study-specific random effects logit scale model. Write logit(x)=log{x/(1âˆ’x)}\mbox{logit}(x)=\log\{x/(1-x)\}. logit(Ï€i)=Î±0+Îµilogit(qi)=(Î²0+b0i)+(Î²1+b1i)logit(pi),\begin{align}\tag{1} \mbox{logit}(\pi_i)&= \alpha_0 + \varepsilon_i\\ \mbox{logit}(q_i) &= (\beta_0 + b_{0i}) + (\beta_1 + b_{1i})\mbox{logit}(p_i), \end{align} (Î±0,Î²0,Î²1)(\alpha_0, \beta_0, \beta_1) fixed effects, Îµiâˆ¼N(0,ÏƒÏ€2)\varepsilon_i\sim N(0, \sigma_\pi^2), bi=(b0i,b1i)Tâˆ¼N(0,Î£b)b_i=(b_{0i}, b_{1i})^{T}\sim N(0, \Sigma_b), ÎµiâŠ¥bi\varepsilon_i\perp b_i. particular, model (1) maximally allows study--study variations prevalence (generally negative) correlation sensitivity specificity. Let ğ’\mathcal C denote set indices complete data observed. Thus âˆˆğ’ii\\mathcal C_i, complete estimates Ï€Ì‚\hat\pi, pÌ‚\hat p_i, qÌ‚\hat q_i. Using pseudo-observations (1), can estimate parameters Î±Ì‚=mean{logit(Ï€Ì‚):âˆˆğ’}\hat\alpha=\mbox{mean}\{\mbox{logit}(\hat\pi_i): \\mathcal C\}, ÏƒÌ‚Ï€2=var{logit(Ï€Ì‚):âˆˆğ’}\hat\sigma_\pi^2=\mbox{var}\{\mbox{logit}(\hat\pi_i): \\mathcal C\}, Î²Ì‚=\hat\beta= least-squares estimate logit(qÌ‚) vs logit(pÌ‚)\mbox{logit}(\hat q_i) \mbox{ vs }\mbox{logit}(\hat p_i)(âˆˆğ’)(\\mathcal C). Finally, Î£b\Sigma_b can estimated Î£Ì‚b=|ğ’|varÌ‚(Î²Ì‚)\hat\Sigma_b=|\mathcal C|\hat{\mbox{var}}(\hat\beta), |ğ’||\mathcal C| number studies ğ’\mathcal C varÌ‚(Î²Ì‚)\hat{\mbox{var}}(\hat\beta) estimated variance matrix Î²Ì‚\hat\beta standard least squares.

title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: âˆˆğ’Â¯={=1,â€¦,m:FNi TNi missing}\\overline{\mathcal C}=\{=1,\ldots, m: \mbox{FN}_i \mbox{ } \mbox{TN}_i \mbox{ missing}\}, know NiN_i pÌ‚\hat p_i, impute FNi\mbox{FN}_i TNi\mbox{TN}_i. multiple times drawing random effects model (1), order account certainty missing values. jjth imputation, âˆˆğ’Â¯\\overline{\mathcal C}: Draw Îµi(j)âˆ¼N(0,ÏƒÌ‚Ï€2)\varepsilon_i^{(j)}\sim N(0, \hat\sigma_\pi^2); bi(j)âˆ¼N(0,Î£Ì‚b)b_i^{(j)}\sim N(0,\hat\Sigma_b); Compute Ï€Ì‚(j)\hat\pi_i^{(j)} qÌ‚(j)\hat q_i^{(j)} inserting Î±Ì‚0\hat\alpha_0, Îµi(j)\varepsilon_i^{(j)}, Î²Ì‚\hat\beta, bi(j)b_i^{(j)} model (1); Impute missing values Nâ€¾(j)=Ni(1âˆ’Ï€Ì‚(j))/Ï€Ì‚(j)\bar N_i^{(j)}= N_i(1-\hat\pi_i^{(j)})/\hat\pi_i^{(j)}, FNi(j)=Nâ€¾(j)(1âˆ’qÌ‚(j))\mbox{FN}_i^{(j)} = \bar N_i^{(j)}(1-\hat q_i^{(j)}), TNi(j)=Nâ€¾(j)qÌ‚(j)\mbox{TN}_i^{(j)} = \bar N_i^{(j)}\hat q_i^{(j)}. thus obtain completed dataset ğ’Ÿ(j)={(TPi,FNi,FPi(j),TNi(j)):=1,â€¦,m}, \mathcal D^{(j)}= \{(\mbox{TP}_i, \mbox{FN}_i, \mbox{FP}_i^{(j)}, \mbox{TN}_i^{(j)}): =1,\ldots, m\},  define FPi(j)=FPi\mbox{FP}_i^{(j)}=\mbox{FP}_i TNi(j)=TNi\mbox{TN}_i^{(j)}=\mbox{TN}_i âˆˆğ’i\\mathcal C. Given ğ’Ÿ(j)\mathcal D^{(j)}, can use standard software meta-analysis obtain summary measure diagnostic accuracy, say, summary AUC, denoted AUCÌ‚(j)\hat{\mbox{AUC}}^{(j)}. may also obtain variance varÌ‚(AUCÌ‚(j))\hat{\mbox{var}}(\hat{\mbox{AUC}}^{(j)}). Repeat j=1,â€¦,Jj =1,\ldots, J (e.g., J=500J=500). compute multiply imputed AUC AUCÌ‚=Jâˆ’1âˆ‘j=1JAUCÌ‚(j), \hat{\mbox{AUC}}=J^{-1}\sum_{j=1}^J\hat{\mbox{AUC}}^{(j)},  variance varÌ‚(AUCÌ‚)=Jâˆ’1âˆ‘j=1J(AUCÌ‚(j)âˆ’AUCÌ‚)2âŸ-imputation+Jâˆ’1âˆ‘j=1JvarÌ‚(AUCÌ‚(j))âŸwithin-imputation. \hat{\mbox{var}}(\hat{\mbox{AUC}}) = \underbrace{J^{-1}\sum_{j=1}^J(\hat{\mbox{AUC}}^{(j)} -\hat{\mbox{AUC}})^2}_{\mbox{-imputation}} + \underbrace{J^{-1}\sum_{j=1}^J\hat{\mbox{var}}(\hat{\mbox{AUC}}^{(j)})}_{\mbox{within-imputation}}.  computations can done logit scale AUC improve accuracy approximation.
